intro: Silene otites var. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate bladder campion, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Its leaves are linear and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Silene otites var. intermedia is a perennial species that thrives in low-nutrient conditions and is often found in mountainous or tundra habitats.
